states.name: Rajasthan
states.description: Rajasthan, the largest state in India, is a realm of desert grandeur, majestic forts, and vibrant traditions that echo tales of valor and romance.
states.culture: Known for its royal heritage, Rajasthan showcases magnificent palaces, colorful festivals like Pushkar Camel Fair, and traditional folk music and dance including Ghoomar and Kalbeliya.
states.cuisine: Dal Baati Churma, Laal Maas, Ghewar, Pyaaz Kachori, Ker Sangri

states.name: Kerala
states.description: Kerala is a tropical paradise blessed with serene backwaters, lush hill stations, exotic wildlife, and a rich cultural tapestry.
states.culture: Famous for Kathakali dance, Ayurvedic traditions, boat races, and temple festivals. Kerala has one of the highest literacy rates in India and a unique matrilineal heritage.
states.cuisine: Sadya, Appam with Stew, Puttu and Kadala, Kerala Fish Curry, Banana Chips, Payasam

states.name: West Bengal
states.description: West Bengal is the land of literature, art, and intellectual fervor, where colonial heritage meets Bengali renaissance.
states.culture: Birthplace of Nobel laureate Rabindranath Tagore, renowned for Durga Puja celebrations, Baul folk music, Bengali cinema, and revolutionary movements.
states.cuisine: Macher Jhol, Shorshe Ilish, Mishti Doi, Rosogolla, Sandesh, Kosha Mangsho

states.name: Maharashtra
states.description: Maharashtra is India's economic powerhouse, home to Bollywood, historic forts, and a proud Maratha legacy.
states.culture: Rich in Marathi literature, Lavani folk dance, Warli art, and historic tales of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj. Mumbai is the entertainment capital of India.
states.cuisine: Vada Pav, Pav Bhaji, Misal Pav, Puran Poli, Modak, Bhelpuri

states.name: Tamil Nadu
states.description: Tamil Nadu is the cradle of Dravidian culture, featuring magnificent temples, classical arts, and ancient wisdom.
states.culture: Home to Bharatanatyam dance, Carnatic music, Tamil literature spanning millennia, and Dravidian temple architecture. Tamil is one of the world's oldest living languages.
states.cuisine: Dosa, Idli, Sambar, Chettinad Chicken, Pongal, Filter Coffee, Mysore Pak

states.name: Goa
states.description: Goa is India's smallest state, renowned for its stunning beaches, Portuguese heritage, and laid-back coastal culture.
states.culture: A unique blend of Indian and Portuguese influences reflected in architecture, cuisine, and festivals. Known for vibrant nightlife, carnival celebrations, and church heritage.
states.cuisine: Fish Curry Rice, Bebinca, Vindaloo, Xacuti, Feni, Prawn Balchao

states.name: Punjab
states.description: Punjab is the land of vibrant culture, spiritual heritage, and agricultural prosperity, known for its warmth and hospitality.
states.culture: Home to Sikhism's holiest shrine, the Golden Temple. Famous for Bhangra dance, Giddha, and a rich tradition of folk music and poetry.
states.cuisine: Butter Chicken, Makki di Roti with Sarson da Saag, Chole Bhature, Lassi, Amritsari Kulcha

states.name: Karnataka
states.description: Karnataka offers diverse experiences from IT hub Bengaluru to ancient ruins of Hampi, coffee plantations, and coastal beauty.
states.culture: Rich in classical Carnatic music, Yakshagana theater, diverse handicrafts. Bengaluru is India's Silicon Valley while maintaining traditional arts.
states.cuisine: Bisi Bele Bath, Mysore Masala Dosa, Ragi Mudde, Coorg Pandi Curry, Dharwad Peda
